com.esri.mo2.src.cat
Class BaseContentProvider

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.src.cat.BaseContentProvider
All Implemented Interfaces:
ContentProvider
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConnectionContentProvider, FileSystemContentProvider
public abstract class BaseContentProvider
extends Object
implements ContentProvider

class provides a base implementation of ContentProvider.

In particular, BaseContentProvider provides support for displaying a "context menu" whenever a Content is right-clicked in the Catalog. This is achieved by managing a menu plugin based on ContextMenuProvider. When performAction is invoked with a ContentAction having id ACTION_SHOW_CONTEXT_MENU, the default action is to try to find from the ContextMenuProviders, a provider that supports a content-type that is available from the Content identified by the ContentAction. If found, then that menu is shown as a popup menu relative to the source UI.

BaseContentProvider also provides support for opening a "connection dialog", however this action is delegated to subclasses which must implement openConnectionDialog().

Constructor Detail

BaseContentProvider

public BaseContentProvider()
Method Detail

getRootOpenIconResource

protected String getRootOpenIconResource()
called to obtain an icon for the ContentProvider root Folder when open. Implementations can provide a resource string to identify the icon to be used. This will only be used if the root Folder is constructed as a result of adding this ContentProvider into the CatalogModel - if the root already exists no change will occur. The default provided by this method is the icon identified by the resource "cmn/folderopened.gif".

Returns:
the icon resource for a representation of the root Folder when open
See Also:
Resource.getIcon(java.lang.String), initialize()

getRootClosedIconResource

protected String getRootClosedIconResource()
called to obtain an icon for the ContentProvider root Folder when closed. Implementations can provide a resource string to identify the icon to be used. This will only be used if the root Folder is constructed as a result of adding this ContentProvider into the CatalogModel - if the root already exists no change will occur. The default provided by this method is the icon identified by the resource "cmn/folderclosed.gif".

Returns:
the icon resource for a representation of the root Folder when closed
See Also:
Resource.getIcon(java.lang.String), initialize()

initialize

public void initialize()
                throws Exception
this method initializes the icons of this BaseContentProvider's root Folder using the resources defined by getRootOpenIconResource() and getRootClosedIconResource()

Specified by:
initialize in interface ContentProvider
Throws:
Exception - if the ContentProvider experiences any problem while initializing

getRootPath

public String getRootPath()
identifies the top-level folder of the CatalogModel as the Folder that will contain Content provided by this ContentProvider

Specified by:
getRootPath in interface ContentProvider
Returns:
null == top-level folder of the CatalogModel

constructContent

public Content[] constructContent(Connection connection)
                           throws IOException
if the connection is non-null and of the correct type identified by getConnectionType() then this implementation uses the connection to obtain a Source from the SourceCache and obtains the root Contents of the Source

Specified by:
constructContent in interface ContentProvider
Parameters:
connection - the Connection for which Contents are desired
Returns:
the root Contents of the Source associated with connection
Throws:
IOException - if any problem obtaining the root Contents
See Also:
ContentProvider.getRootPath(), CatalogModel.addConnection(com.esri.mo2.src.sys.Connection)

performAction

public void performAction(ContentAction action)
checks if the Content identified by ContentAction was constructed by this BaseContentProvider using CatalogModel.getProvider(Content) and compares the result with this BaseContentProvider. Ignores the action if not constructed by thiiiis BaseContentProvider.

Specified by:
performAction in interface ContentProvider
Parameters:
action -

openConnectionDialog

protected void openConnectionDialog(Object source,
                                    Content content)
called by performAction when the ContentAction has an id equal ACTION_SHOW_CONNECT_DIALOG. Sub-classes would normally open a user interface dialog to obtain connection parameters, deal with special cases, and, assuming the connection is valid, add the new Connection using the CatalogModel.addConnection().

This implementation does nothing, subclasses should over-ride appropriately if required.

Parameters:
source - the source object that initiated the open dialog, normally it will be a MouseEvent

openContextMenu

protected void openContextMenu(Object source,
                               Content content)
called by performAction when the ContentAction has an id equal ACTION_SHOW_CONTEXT_MENU. This implementation opens a JPopupMenu that is constructed using a menu plugin defined by ContextMenuProvider and selected by the available content-types of the given Content.

Parameters:
source - the source object that initiated the open dialog, normally it is expected to be a MouseEvent

constructFolderMenu

protected JPopupMenu constructFolderMenu(Folder folder)
constructs a standard context menu for a Folder. Subclasses of BaseContentProvider can override to add menu items, or can over-ride openContextMenu() to test for a particular type of Content and open anottttther menu altogether.

Parameters:
folder - the Folder for which a menu is required
Returns:
the popup menu
